greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primitive (=aperiodic) 2n-bead necklaces with colored beads of exactly n different colors.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
maple: a:= n-> add(b(2*n, n-j)*binomial(n, j)*(-1)^j, j=0..n):
mathematica: b[n_, k_] := b[n, k] = If[n==0, 1, DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[n/#]*k^#&]/n]; a[n_] := Sum[b[2n, n-j]*Binomial[n, j]*(-1)^j, {j, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 26 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 25 2015
